meanings.definition: To disperse liquid in a mist or fine drops.
meanings.sent1: She sprayed water on the plants to help them grow.
meanings.sent2: The gardener sprayed insecticide on the roses to keep pests away.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat sprayed water on the unsuspecting dog.
meanings.sent4: The artist sprayed paint on the canvas, creating a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter sprayed water on the blazing fire, extinguishing the flames.

meanings.definition: To apply liquid in a mist or fine drops.
meanings.sent1: He sprayed perfume on his wrist before going out.
meanings.sent2: The chef sprayed olive oil on the salad for extra flavor.
meanings.sent3: The kids sprayed silly string all over the room during the party.
meanings.sent4: The hair stylist sprayed hairspray to set the curls in place.
meanings.sent5: The cleaner sprayed disinfectant on the surfaces to kill germs.

meanings.definition: To cover or treat with a liquid in a mist or fine drops.
meanings.sent1: The farmer sprayed the crops with fertilizer to help them grow.
meanings.sent2: The painter sprayed the walls with primer before painting.
meanings.sent3: The prankster sprayed whipped cream on his friend's face while he was sleeping.
meanings.sent4: The car wash attendant sprayed soap on the vehicle to wash off the dirt.
meanings.sent5: The doctor sprayed numbing spray on the patient's arm before giving an injection.
